bus.name: Express-2000
bus.description: Highly flexible satellite bus designed and manufactured by ISS Reshetnev.

descriptionShort.descriptionShort: A Russian geostationary satellite built for the Russian Ministry of Defence and Federal Security Service (FSB). The satellite is also referred to as "Luch". It is believed to be a signals intelligence satellite.

descriptionLong.descriptionLong:
Olymp-K is a Russian geostationary satellite built for the Russian Ministry of Defence and Federal Security Service (FSB). The satellite is also referred to as "Luch". It is believed to be a signals intelligence satellite. Olymp-K was launched on 28 September 2014. 
The Proton-M rocket with a Briz-M upper stage launched from Baikonur Cosmodrome launchpad 81/24 in Kazakhstan at 20:23 UTC. After four burns of the Briz-M upper stage it was placed into geosynchronous transfer orbit.[4][1] In a press release on 28 September 2014, Roscosmos referred to the satellite as "Luch".
